item.title: Does Dying Light: The Beast Have Early Access?
item.content:encoded:
Whenever a game is delayed, the desire to play it as soon as possible intensifies. Dying Light: The Beast fans have had to experience this pain, which is why early access would be a terrific boon to lessen the wait.

Dying Light: The Beast was delayed by 4 weeks. If it was the game you were most looking forward to in 2025, I can imagine you’ve been in your own zombie-like state throughout August and the early parts of September. Techland seems confident in The Beast’s revised release date. I can tell you that Insider Gaming’s recent hands-on preview should give you cause for excitement.

It’s hit and miss if single-player games have early access—which is where Dying Light: The Beast comes into the undead equation.

Can You Play Dying Light: The Beast With Early Access?

As of writing, there is no Dying Light: The Beast early access, meaning the first real opportunity to play the game is via its September 19 release date.

Dying Light: The Beast does have a special deluxe edition. But it doesn’t feature 24, 48, or even 7-day early access. It includes special cosmetic skins, the game’s official soundtrack, and other handy in-game items. But there’s definitely no early access to get you to part ways with more money.

In fairness, the deluxe edition is only a handful of dollars more than the standard edition. If it did offer early access, I expect there’d be a greater discrepancy in price. As an old-school gamer, I’m happy when games don’t offer this, as it’s better when everyone can jump in together on the same day, avoid spoilers, and get a chance to experience the hilarious and bizarre antics in unison.

Is There A Dying Light: The Beast Demo?

There’s not even a Dying Light: The Beast demo for you to get a small taster of what’s to come.

Techland is adamant about the game’s content. The only way you play Dying Light: The Beast is on release day. If you need snippets of gameplay and details on the game and its development, though, the Insider Gaming Trailers YouTube page has a ton of Dyihng Light: The Beast content to watch.

Check out the Blood & Guts Trailer right here.

The Insider Gaming forum is home to daily gaming conversations. Here, you can talk about your love for Dying Light as a whole and why The Beast could be an upgrade on Dying Light 2.

Insider Gaming has a ton of other Dying Light: The Beast content to browse. We have the complete set of minimum and recommended PC Specs, as well as all Dying Light: The Beast Pre-Order bonuses.

item.title: 007 First Light Devs Insist It Isn’t a Hitman “Reskin”
item.content:encoded:
007 First Light developers have clarified that it isn’t a reskin of Hitman and is different in many aspects.

007 First Light received an exclusive State of Play event yesterday, which featured 30 minutes of gameplay along with the release date announcement and pre-order details. Since then, a new interview has emerged in which the developers have clarified that the James Bond game is distinct from Hitman.

007 First Light’s Driving Was A “Huge Challenge”

Speaking to GamesRadar+, senior licensing producer Theuns Smit explained how Hitman and 007 First Light are two different games. Smit first talked about how they have a very talented team that has expanded significantly since the game was announced. They were able to bring in fresh talent, which, along with the existing staff, became “a really big growth moment” for the studio.

The new developers were able to bring in “fresh eyes, fresh expertise, all of that” while also relying on IO Interactive’s strengths and their 25 years of massive experience. However, Smit explains that it is about the game and experience first, stating, “If you’re looking at Hitman, it’s the way it is for a particular reason, because that’s the gameplay experience we want to give. For Bond, it’s not exactly that. It’s not a reskin of that.”

Smit then spoke about driving, describing it as “absolutely a huge challenge,” and they had to bring on developers with driving expertise, which included “people that had experience coding, setting up, tweaking, balancing.” He added that it is “a balancing act of making a vehicle feel both exciting, credible, and dangerous at the same time as being approachable and fun for a wide audience.” Finding this balance was difficult and a “new adventure” for them, but they feel they have “landed in an amazing space.”

In other news, Insider Gaming received an exclusive Gamescom Preview for 007 First Light and “couldn’t stop seeing Hitman with a James Bond skin.” Additionally, the game’s collector’s edition will set players back $300. Do you think 007 First Light is a reskin of Hitman? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

item.title: Dying Light: The Beast Release Date Explained—Exact Start Times & Release Date Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Techland is set to make us all feel alive again with Dying Light: The Beast—the third mainline entry in the survival horror series. If you want to know Dying Light: The Beast’s release date and launch times, you’ve come to the right, safe place.

Dying Light: The Beast has been a long time coming. What started as DLC has become a beast within its own right. The Beast is smaller but more focused and dense compared to Dying Light 2. Old-school fans are thrilled to learn that OG protagonist Kyle Crane is back—even if he has become an unexpected thirst trap!

We’ve loved Dying Light: The Beast in our initial Insider Gaming previews. So let’s see its release date and what to expect.

When is Dying Light: The Beast Coming Out?

Dying Light: The Beast is locked in for a September 19 release date across various platforms.

The hearts of the Dying Light community were broken back in July 2025 when Techland announced Dying Light: The Beast was delayed by 4 weeks. The official reasons given were “To allow for extra polishing work” and “Finetuning the balance of gameplay elements, looking into clarity of UI, increasing the quality of physics, as well as tweaking cutscene and player animations further.”

Again, we’ve played The Beast, and the improvements are noticeable. Expectations are very high for Dying Light: The Beast, and its release date (and start times) can’t come soon enough.

Do We Know Dying Light: The Beast’s Start Times?

According to the PlayStation Store, Dying Light: The Beast is dropping at 9 PM PDT on September 18.

Dying Light: The Beast’s PSN listing shows the exact start time for BST above. However, this translates into 9 PM PDT on Friday, September 18. If PlayStation has this information wrong, we’ll update the guide. For now, you can go ahead with this information.

I’ve also listed off some other time zone starts for you below.

item.title: Batman Arkham Shadow Sequel Confirmed by Voice Actor
item.content:encoded:
A Batman Arkham Shadow sequel will be entering development soon, according to the comments of a voice actor.

LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight is the Batman title every player is looking forward to at the moment; however, there might be another title soon entering development that will feature the Caped Crusader. The game in question is the award-winning sequel to Camouflaj and Oculus Studios’ VR game, Batman: Arkham Shadow.

Batman Arkham Shadow Sequel Will Begin Development Soon

Spotted by UploadVR, the voice actor for Commissioner Gordon confirmed Batman Arkham Shadow’s sequel during an interview with Culture Combine. Mark Rolston, is the voice actor for Gordon in Batman Arkham Shadow, who is also known for playing characters like Norman Osborn in Marvel’s Spider-Man series, Lex Luthor in Injustice: Gods Among Us, and many more games.

During the interview, Rolston was asked about how it is different working on games like Blade Runner and Spider-Man 2. He revealed that with Blade Runner, he was only doing voice-over, whereas Spider-Man had “complete motion capture, voice, and everything.” Rolston added that he has done the same for the Batman Arkham Shadow VR game, revealing that they’re “about to start another one of those.” No other details were revealed.

For those unaware, Batman: Arkham Shadow is a VR Game, exclusively available on the Meta Quest 3 and 3S. The game is set between the events of Arkham Origins and Arkham Asylum, where players take on the role of Batman as they confront the Rat King. The title features Arkham Combat, which has been remade for VR, incorporating gadgets and fighting styles from the popular game series. The title was awarded ‘Best VR/AR Game’ at The Game Awards.

In other news, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight will feature an open world larger than Arkham Knight’s. Additionally, potential footage for the cancelled Damian Wayne Batman game surfaced online a few months ago. What are your thoughts on Batman Arkham Shadow’s sequel being confirmed? item.title: Helldivers 2 Sold More on Xbox Than PlayStation in The First Six Days
item.content:encoded:
Helldivers 2 has sold more copies on Xbox than PlayStation within the first six days of launch.

The Xbox launch has been a great plan for Helldivers 2, contributing to the Steam player count in recent days as well. Moreover, Arrowhead has also released the collaboration with HALO ODST alongside this launch, along with all the content the game has released since launch may have helped push more players over the edge. Now, new sales details for Helldivers 2 on Xbox have been revealed.

Helldivers 2 Sold Close to a Million Copies on Xbox in the First Six Days

Spotted by Gamerant, the latest Alinea Insight newsletter has provided sales details for games in August, which includes Helldivers 2. Helldivers 2 has sold 926,000 copies on Xbox in the first six days. Compared to Helldivers 2’s PlayStation launch last year, it only sold 633,000 copies in the first six days.

It was a momentous occasion this month, as both PlayStation and Xbox had their exclusives release on each other’s platforms. Helldivers 2 for Xbox launched alongside Gears of War: Reloaded for PlayStation. However, the latter only accounted for 241,000 downloads, whereas Helldivers 2 has sold close to a million copies on Xbox.

Helldivers 2 has also made it to the top of Xbox’s “top paid games list“, with Helldivers 2 and Helldivers 2: Super Citizen Edition taking the first and third place, respectively. The list also includes NBA 2K26, EA Sports Madden NFL 26, and NBA 2k26 Leave No Doubt Edition.

In other news, Helldivers 2’s latest update introduced randomly-generated caves, new enemies, and much more. Also, the developers have stated that co-op split-screen is “technically feasible” for the game. What are your thoughts on Helldivers 2 selling more on Xbox than PlayStation in the first six days? item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 4 Early Patch Notes—Angela, Buffs & Nerfs, New Modes, & More
item.content:encoded:
Season 4 of Marvel Rivals is rapidly approaching, bringing major changes and additions to the game, and we’ve got all the early details for the patch notes.

As is customary with a new season in Marvel Rivals, a new playable character, new maps, and new Team-Ups are being added, while there was also the big announcement that the game will finally be released on PlayStation 4.

For a full overview of what’s being added in Marvel Rivals Season 4, including a look at the buffs and nerfs, take a look at our early patch notes.

Marvel Rivals Season 4 Heart of the Dragon Early Patch Notes

The full patch notes for Marvel Rivals Season 4 have not been shared yet. However, we do have an overview of some of the major additions and changes.

In the latest Dev Vision video, general details were provided of the new additions to the character roster, maps, and game modes. This was then followed by details of the buffs and nerfs for Season 4.

We’ve split the early patch notes for Marvel Rivals Season 4 into specific sections below to make it easier to navigate.

Angela – New Playable Character

Angela, Asgard’s Assassin and sister of Thor, is arriving at the start of Season 4 as the latest playable character, filling the Vanguard role.

Equipped with Ichors, a type of living fluid that can be used to create various weapons. A razor-sharp spear is used to dive on enemies, while a shield is used to block incoming damage. Finally, the Ichors can be transformed into dual axes to dish out significant damage.

Team Up Adjustments

Marvel Rivals Season 4 adds a new Team-Up, removes another, and adjusts the members of two others. We’ve detailed them below.

  • NEW: Divine Armory – Angela shares fragments of her Ichors with Thor (Angela, Thor).
  • REMOVED: Dimensional Shortcut has been removed (Magik, Black Panther).
  • ADDED: Magik joins Arcane Order and gains a new ability (Doctor Strange, Scarlet Witch).
  • ADDED: Black Panther joins Gamma Charge, gaining a shield that triggers on low health (Hulk, Namor).

Buffs & Nerfs

Full details of the buffs and nerfs to characters in Season 4 will be revealed in the full patch notes, but we’ve highlighted all the affected heroes below.

Buffs

  • Peni Parker
  • Thor
  • Doctor Strange
  • Scarket Witch
  • Blade
  • Moon Knight
  • Invisible Woman
  • Jeff the Land Shark
  • Ultron

Nerfs

  • Emma Frost
  • Captain America
  • Squirrel Girl
  • Black Panther
  • Psylocke
  • Luna Snow
  • Loki

Heart of Heaven – New Map

Launching on September 25, Heart of Heaven is a new Convergence map, set in the ancient city of K’un-Lun.

Arcade Mode Hub

Arcade Mode in Marvel Rivals is getting a significant update in Season 4, with the Clone Rumble and Giant-Size Brain Blast returning permanently.

A new mode, Free Fight, allows players to play with no restrictions on duplicate heroes, so you can unleash an entire six-man team of Jeff the Land Shark, if you want. Conquest (Annihilation) is another new mode, where points are secured through KOs.

In the Arcade Mode hub, you can queue for a specific mode, or queue for several at the same time.

Summer Special Vol. 2

The next part of the Summer Special in Marvel Rivals lands in Season 4, introducing swimsuit costumes for The Punisher, The Thing, The Invisible Woman, and Mantis.

New costumes land on September 18, with it likely that there is another Event Pass similarly to the first volume, though this is yet to be confirmed.

Other Changes

Several other changes were highlighted in the Dev Vision video, which we’ve detailed below.

  • Ultimate Ability custom VFX is now global, but can be turned off if you choose.
  • New Accessories on September 25 for Magneto, Cloak & Dagger, Scarlet Witch, and Luna Snow, featuring characters like Polaris and Quicksilver.
  • Favorites bar available to create a Strike Squad, allowing for quicker hero selection.
  • Hero slow-walk support added to PC.
  • Gallery Card download feature.
  • Customizable chat text-color and animated emojis, available from September 18.
  • Next stage of College Perks program.
  • Ignite Stage 2 Esports Schedule announced.

Which of the changes coming in Marvel Rivals Season 4 are you most excited for? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Kidas CEO Says Roblox Age Verification Measures Are “Easily Bypassed” And Are “Not The Full Answer”
item.content:encoded:
Despite The Roblox Corporation’s best intentions to protect children with new age verification tools, Kidas CEO Ron Kerbs believes it’s not enough, and has told Insider Gaming that Roblox needs to incorporate “Real-time behavioral monitoring.”

A new wave of age verification has emerged in the last 12 months, with businesses worldwide beginning to clamp down on who can access specific content. GTA Online is reportedly getting age verification, for example, and Roblox has added security measures to protect teenagers in 2025.

There have been concerns that while this is a good start, a lot more needs to be done.

Roblox Requires Real-Time Behavioral Monitoring, Says Kidas CEO

Ron Kerbs is the CEO of Kidas: A “Cybersecurity company committed to enhancing the safety of young gamers in the digital realm. Employing advanced AI technology, ProtectMe monitors and mitigates cyberbullying, online predators, and other digital threats in real time.

The company’s goal is simple: Protect kids and young gamers from online predators and harassment so they can enjoy video games with safety and peace of mind.

Insider Gaming has obtained an exclusive quote from Ron discussing Roblox’s recent age verification measures:

“Roblox’s new age verification effort is a step in the right direction—but it’s not the full answer. While technology like facial analysis and ID scans can help restrict access to mature content, these tools are still easily bypassed and don’t address the most pressing safety issues kids face online every day.”

Kidas has seen evidence of how predators operate and take advantage of younger children, and is doing all it can to increase security measures:

The reality is that no verification method—AI or otherwise—can guarantee that the person behind a screen is who they claim to be. We’ve seen kids be groomed and scammed by individuals who pass verification checks but still engage in harmful behavior. What’s needed isn’t just more gates, but better guardrails. Roblox and platforms like it must invest in real-time behavioral monitoring, not just one-time identity checks. Protecting kids isn’t about proving you’re over 13—it’s about detecting when a conversation is going dangerously off track and stepping in fast. We applaud the intention. Now let’s raise the standard for execution.

We definitely need to see more action like this and companies paying greater attention to child safety. Kidas says it’s protected over 400,000 gamers and counting and issues an alarming statistic on its home page: “3 out of 5 U.S. kids who play online games will be scammed or harassed before age 18.”

Insider Gaming wants to know what you think. Is enough being done to protect young gamers who just want to experience the joys and thrills we all had growing up playing games without the fear of strangers and predators on the internet? Please let us know.
